11.content:
Ranek surveyed the empty savanna before him, and sighed. Nothing interesting over here. He lingered a moment longer, hoping for something, anything, but soon resigned himself to the dull company of his peers.

Later that evening, Ranek rested in his personal quarters, starved for entertainment. Such was often the case for him. The meerkat could never find pleasure in the routine activities of the day, and the fantasies his mind supplied were, he feared, to... bizzarre to ever come to fullfilment. Therefore, it was of no large surprise to himself that he found, in the privacy of his home, his paw slipping lower, and his mind turning to darker, more taboo thoughts.

Frozen in fear, Ranek could only whimper in protest as the large, playful, and very dangerous feline flattens him under a steady paw. The lion's weight keeping the unfortunate meerkat pinned helpless under the predatory gaze of the massive feline.

"Ah...a meerkat," smirked the lion domineeringly, "how cute. And I was just getting bored to...."

"B-bored?" Ranek mummured awkwardly, squirming, the bitter, leathery musk of the lion's foot-paws starting to get to him. Oddly enough, he seemed to find the musty scent...intriging.

"Oh yes," The lion's muzzle split as he smirked wider, adding more pressure onto our meerkat in response to his struggles. The slight movement cupping the little creature's snout between his toes, forcing Ranek to breathe in his foul scent, "you'll make a fine toy I'm sure...how do you feel about that?"

123.content:
Sweat poured down his muzzle as the cheetah lowered its head. The cat immediately pressed a paw against the meerkat's tiny form.

"Hmm..." it growled, "what's this? Astray from your pack? A solo meerkat?" a male voice questioned. Ranek wanted to protest and scream out with all his might but fear kept him in place. "What, cat got your-" he paused, "body, I guess? What would you call it?" It asked. Ranek was too stiff with shock to register this as an actual question he was to reply to. "Speak!"

"I- I guess it- it would b- be you have my b- body?" Ranek quickly stuttered. The cheetah burst into laughter. Ranek couldn't help but give a nervous chuckle at the sound, although he wish he hadn't because the cheetah spoke once more.

"Silence!" he commanded. Ranek whimpered. "Now... where was I?" he pondered. Ranek didn't dare move a single muscle. "I don't exactly feel hungry, and you wouldn't be much more than a simple treat," the cat sighed, Ranek doesn't know how to feel being talked to like this, "you must be small enough to go somewhere else though... you got any friends with you?"

A part of Ranek wanted to reason with the cheetah, but what would that do him? The sudden thought of ratting his pack out seemed to bright up his face. No! No, no, no! That was wrong! How could he think of that?

"No, I'll never tell you!" Ranek grunted with a bit of courage, this only forced the cat to extend his claws.

"What was that?" He growled ferociously, "Trying to be brave now? Bit late for that, you should have run the moment we made eye contact," he meowed into the inferior meerkat's ear, "as I was thinking..."

12533222.content: Aardwolfs are a species of hyena. They primarily eat insects, though meerkats aren't off the menu...
12533222.title: Other

choices: Ranek asked Adelmo about his adventures.
One of the meerkats offered themselves to Adelmo.
125332221.content:
It was almost nightfall, so it was a bit dark outside, but Ranek could still make out a strange silhouette looming before him. He tensed up in fear, but relaxed immediately as the figure stepped into the light. “Hey, Ran. It’s been a while, huh?” The huge canine smiled warmly at the little meerkat, as the two animals friendlily bumped their paws together. This visitor was none other than Adelmo. Adelmo is a friendly, rambunctious aardwolf -- a type of hyena -- who was one of the only non-meerkats the family was allied with. Once or twice every month, Adelmo would come visit the meerkats, bringing them a big cut of meat in exchange for some insects. Being an aardwolf, Adelmo was best at scavenging meat, but found insects tastier. In turn, the meerkats were best at catching insects, but found meat tastier. Thus, the trade benefited both groups equally, and both spent all the night feasting and celebrating.

You see, Adelmo was sadly abandoned by his previous pack after permanently wounding his hind leg while hunting a buffalo, and also because his previous pack thought that he was ‘too gross’. Being a social animal, this left him feeling extremely betrayed and lonely. Soon after this, he stumbled upon the meerkat mob. Being a predator, Adelmo could’ve devoured all the meerkats easily -- however, he found the meerkats charming instead of appetizing, and quickly became considered a friend to the family. Adelmo trots right on by Ranek, his pawsteps shaking the ground under the tiny meerkat’s feet. The other meerkats yelled and cheered when the aardwolf arrived, heralding a night of feasting and fun.

Ranek rushed over to the clearing, and found that a tiny bonfire had already been struck up in the middle of the circle, with Adelmo and the meerkats sitting around it. The aardwolf told jokes and recalled stories about his adventures in between mouthfuls of squirming insects. Ranek joined the circle, and somehow found himself sitting right next to the laughing hyena. Adelmo wasn’t overwhelmingly taller than the meerkats, standing at only about 16 inches tall, but he was still about five or six times larger. Ranek seemed kind of intimidated by his size, even though he knew he was friendly. At such close proximity, the next thing that struck him was the smell. Ugh! The aardwolf farted! While no one was looking, Adelmo winked at the meerkat sitting next to him, scooting his gigantic butt closer to him so the smell could better reach Ranek's nostrils. Adelmo was a huge fan of all things gross, mostly because he loved the attention. Ranek knew reacting would only encourage him, so he tried to just ignore the smell, but only grew more nauseous as the SBDs seemed to keep coming, with no end in sight.

Amidst the partying and celebration of the colony, Ranek suffered silently, trying to clench his nose shut. He didn’t know how much longer he could take this. He desperately hoped for some kind of distraction...
125332221.title: Aardwolf
